snippet: Mexican federal officials say Grupo Mexico, a mining conglomerate, will pay for damage caused when one of its mines spilled acid-laced copper sulfate and heavy metals into two rivers in northern Mexico.
abstract: Grupo Mexico, mining conglomerate in Mexico, will set up $151 million trust to pay for damage caused when one of its mines spilled acid-laced copper sulfate and heavy metals into two rivers in northern Mexico on Aug 7.
lead_paragraph: Mexican federal officials say Grupo Mexico, a mining conglomerate, will pay for damage caused when one of its mines spilled acid-laced copper sulfate and heavy metals into two rivers in northern Mexico.

headline.main: Mexico: Trust to Pay for Spill Damage
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Trust to Pay for Spill Damage
